text: Hi I'm in london tomorrow at a creature vfx gathering at Tower tavern just down the road from Blue zoo, I should be there around 19:20. It will be nice to meet if you are about :)

Hey, I'm afraid I have another part time job on tuesdays so I wont be able to make it :disappointed: But I'm gonna have another look at your reel now so you can choose what shots to refine :slightly_smiling_face:

Ok, so i would definitely keep the red backflip, and the parkour shot too but I would spline it (it's looking reaaallly nice) as well as the dog cycle for body mechanics. I would also keep the chimpanzee shot and the cat shot as they would be the easiest to refine and have a lot of potential. I think the 'tv show' lipsync shot has too much hand movement and the acting choices would need a bit of refining as well, so it might take too long to get it show reel ready. It would be safer to invest that energy into the other shots :slightly_smiling_face: your 2d stuff is also really nice, so I would keep it in there :slightly_smiling_face:
for the rendered chimpanzee shot, I would rerender it once it's finished and only show it once throughout the showreel
I hope you enjoy the creature vfx event, its a shame I cant go
Thanks so much for the help I really appreciate all the advice and help you give :), oh well I'm sure there will be over chances to meet up at events. :)
